full_text: .@LornaBogue & @oliver_moran Are two of our 5 Cork candidates. I chatted to them in the English market this morning, to hear what have been the critical election issues so far. #wantgreenvotegreen #GE2020  #corksouthcentral #corknorthcentral https://t.co/lwYkJJzLQJ

I'm convinced Cork City & County will rise as we make a green just transition. With stronger local government building public transport & housing together, local business leading out a healthy food revolution & the Port becoming a new energy hub. #wantgreenvotegreen #Cork #GE2020 https://t.co/psZ7pSExx9

His top priority is to improve public transport, cycling & pedestrian facilities right across the county. More frequent rail times & better rural bus services is the best way of freeing people from the current gridlock & long commutes. @stevensgreen1 #WantGreenVoteGreen #GE2020 https://t.co/18N8Qtu3Vd

There was a great crew out canvassing for @stevensgreen1 in Bray and Greystones today. We think he is in with a real chance of winning the last seat. Every #1 vote will count. #WantGreenVoteGreen #GE2020 #wicklow https://t.co/nI5EaXB29o

“In this last week I think there’s one question that needs to be asked of other parties and that is around what their real plans are on climate change because it’s been ignored so far in this election.” https://t.co/mxVVC2leKY
Happy to do so. https://t.co/iXWp2U9zbb

.@MarkDearey speaks to the #artsfunding hustings in Drogheda tonight. I can't think of a better possible representative for the people of Louth & Meath East. Long time councillor, campaigner and local business man. He'd make a great TD. #Campaign4Arts #GE2020 #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/dTKO60himG
Thank you to all those who were able to join the conversation with me  @PrezWex and @unicefireland! #GE2020 #GE2020Youth #VoteForEveryChild https://t.co/59F7oTb6Wk

@unicefireland @greenparty_ie @UReportIRL The solutions to tackle the climate & biodiversity crisis will require us to change everything & we need to make sure it is a change for the better.  More cycling, walking & Public transport, restoring our towns & village communities, healthier food, our own local energy supply.

@unicefireland @PresWex I think we need to resource the local GP and psychiatric services better and try and get as much early intervention for people at risk.  We have the right health plans in 'Vision for Change' and 'slaintecare' in place, it is now a matter of implementing them properly.

@unicefireland @PresWex We need to provide more student housing on campus but I'm shocked how much that can sometimes cost. We could bring rents down by scaling up new building methods involving modular designs. We also advocate new cost rental solutions, for everyone including students around town.

@unicefireland @PresWex We'd start by insulating our social housing stock so people don't have expensive heating bills.  Then provide a better & cheaper public transport system to help those who can't afford a car. Last but not least, I'd give carbon tax revenue back as a dividend, which helps everyone.

@unicefireland @PresWex For 40 years our party has been advocating for LGBTQI+ rights. I think this measure could be introduced from the design stage as we build new public buildings and upgrade public spaces.
@unicefireland @PresWex Our policy expects we would need to provide some €90m to fund the initiative which would be administered via GPs and primary health care centres.

Delighted to be answering questions from young people today as part of UNICEF Ireland's #TwitterTakeover. Young people have a right to have their voices heard and I'm looking forward to hearing what matters most to them today. Let's go! #GE2020 #GE2020Youth #VoteForEveryChild https://t.co/zRSM2aEszM

"I'm proud of our party and ask you to give your local @greenparty_ie candidate your number 1 vote, so we start this critical decade on the right path." My closing message at the #VMTVBigDebate last night. #WantGreenVoteGreen #GE2020 https://t.co/3TXEW43d9o

.@CByrneGreen at @artscouncil_ie #GE2020 on future funding for the arts. We want to raise multi-year funding, include creative spaces in new public developments, promote a creative schools programme & take back the night for dancing. #artsfunding #Campaign4art #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/3v2eqwu7yM

I joined @mwhitedonegal via Skype yesterday for a press conference with @DonegalDaily & @Donegal_News outlining how we could improve public transport to the North West and create jobs in Digital hubs such as @Colab_NorthWest. #WantGreenVoteGreen #GE2020 https://t.co/EKeAsDBZkB
Speaking to reporters after the #VMTVBigDebate about what should be the big question for the last week of #GE2020 https://t.co/P9kKjhjcDB
Listen back to my leaders debate with @IvanYatesNT yesterday. https://t.co/mNE3ie2PLk via @newstalkfm

'Maybe we just need the media to soften on this outmoded and, quite frankly, dangerous narrative that climate change is just one of a number of problems we face as an electorate, and a distant one at that.' @Niall_Sargent https://t.co/rKJydqvsoF

'The relative contributions of agriculture, transport, industry and other sectors to reducing emissions must be debated. But the environment is far too important to be treated as a political football between town and country." https://t.co/WGZtEnw7JV

Good debate with @IFAmedia this afternoon on the future of Irish farming. We have to work together to protect the Irish family farm and insure the long term sustainability of our food and natural systems. https://t.co/aQZGfZYf06
Warming up for the #ge2020 leaders debate on @rte tonight, by heading out canvassing with our #GalwayWest candidate @paulinegalway. @ClaireByrneLive https://t.co/jXQhltRDSS
@DonaldClarke63 Donald, sorry to hear that. Hope you are recovering.
@stejmurphy We are ruling no one out.

'a block of Green & centre-left TDs could, if they were prepared to act together in a coherent & disciplined manner, transform the government-formation process & in doing so direct the shape & content of the next administration’s programme for government.' https://t.co/vzfFj4bkXa

Artist, grower, filmmaker, eco-activist & author of 'The Local Food Project' @lisafingleton asks why are we not growing vegetables in Ireland?  Only 1% of Irish farms grow vegetables, the lowest in the EU. Like many others in https://t.co/t76bhJ9qIh she is turning things around. https://t.co/WEk5kTLK7Q

Klaus & Geraldine Woessner of https://t.co/eRmRjLNl7r were one of the first Irish Cosmetics Producers to be certified organic. They make the products themselves on the road from Kilgarvan to Killarney. I've got a bottle of their foot cream to give to the Healy-Raes post election. https://t.co/jxI6yZziG8

. https://t.co/PlNx5Hb7y7 is run by Catriona Fallon and is an extension of the Green Arts initiative operated by https://t.co/qNkKXchZjx. It aims to provide Irish arts organisations with the resources and support to help build a green Irish arts community. https://t.co/m95q8GQZkS

Ciaran Coffey of https://t.co/SjYtii3yBv has invented a micro scale anaerobic digester, to convert domestic food waste into methane for use in the gas cooker. This is the sort of distributed energy solution we need, rather than pushing industrial agriculture to feed the gas grid. https://t.co/9efhN8sxh3

Sean & Siobhan Coles O'Sullivan have taken over Knockatte Natural Dairy in Tuosist and are making cheeses and pork products for the best local shops & restaurants. The excess whey is fed to the pigs, who spend the autumn grazing acorns in a local oak wood. https://t.co/7QjNBL5UFl https://t.co/LjsYpKKqru

Some parties in #GE2020 argue rural Ireland should hold back from  a green transition. Last night @cleomurphy64 brought together Kerry people who are showing how the change will be good for the whole country. I think most Irish people want to play their part. #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/C3N2gMCSFZ
Shame @rte https://t.co/MAR2X0l3a3

I'm with @cleomurphy64 who is running for us in #Kerry. Her priorities are to improve public transport, promote food security and energy independence and a healthy local economy. #wantgreenvotegreen #ge2020 https://t.co/00HKJF5kUF

She's an energetic, hard working, well organised, community campaigner, mother and teacher and she is running in #RoscommonGalway. @Julie_ODonoghue #GE2020 #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/46zglY454J https://t.co/zodXS8ulkY

We've teams of people canvassing across the country. It is a cornerstone of our democracy that  candidates go out and ask people directly for a vote. Great crew out with @TheGreenMcCabe in Ashbourne this afternoon. #wantgreenvotegreen #GE2020 @greenparty_ie https://t.co/ZcQFQbGjCf

.@TheGreenMcCabe is our candidate in #meatheast. He has real expertise in how we could do a #JustTransition so that people gain from the changes we need to make to tackle climate change. Warmer homes - affordable public transport - healthy local food. #wantgreenvotegreen #GE2020 https://t.co/hyPpPD9Mu3

If we combined that new housing with the restoration of our historic high streets, we could bring people back living, shopping & working together in vibrant & safe local communities  She's a real chance of winning a seat. @louheavin #GE2020 #wantgreenvotegreen #LongfordWestmeath https://t.co/bSUW3mPHJG

I spent the morning canvassing the streets of Athlone with @louheavin. One of her priorities is to identify public lands close to the centre of towns across the constituency, which could be used for cost rental and other public housing solutions. #GE2020 #wantgreenvotegreen https://t.co/9aFyDbB6gd

@moranjohna1 @KeithMillsD7 @greenparty_ie I think you have put it well. Alternative routes could bring significant savings, which could be invested in public transport and walking and cycling infrastructure in both Cork and Limerick.

.@MarcKC_Green launched his #GE2020 Waterford campaign in style last night. @ParlourTeaRooms. 'I've deeply held social democratic values... The changes we've to make in our society have to be made for everybody, protecting everyone, bringing everyone with us.' #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/6pgbVY63m8

We called into @CartoonSaloon where there are employing 300 people in the town centre. It's a great example of how we could bring life back into our towns, delivering sustainable and balanced regional development for all our people. #WantGreenVoteGreen @noonan_malcolm #GE2020 https://t.co/5KiyWmTfQB

Spent the afternoon canvassing with @noonan_malcolm in Kilkenny. He has been campaigning for years for a bus service for the city, which has finally arrived to great acclaim. For more of the same #votegreen1 on 8th February. #WantGreenVoteGreen  #GE2020 @KKPeopleNews https://t.co/uxMFM0eZPF

Behind every successful candidate there has to be a great team. @VincentPMartin1 is fortunate to have two brilliant campaign managers. The game is on in North Kildare. We are fighting for the last seat. #WantGreenVoteGreen #GE2020 @GreensKildare https://t.co/wKCxrX7v8F

Great crowd at our @DBSGreens canvassing workshop this morning. Knocking on doors to answer people's questions and ask for a vote is a cornerstone of our democracy.  If you want to take part please contact your local @greenparty_ie candidate and give it a go. #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/FT4g7NHQN6

Ever thought you'd like to get involved in the election but don't know?  Then please come to a 'canvassing workshop' we are holding tomorrow at 11am in the Hilton Hotel, Charlemont. #wantgreenvotegreen https://t.co/gGtNNLms6c @EventbriteIE
I am holding my election launch and fundraiser tomorrow evening in Rody Bolands Pub in Rathmines at 7pm.  https://t.co/IfQoi4uaWa https://t.co/rK4sYADxjz

.@vonderleyen was in Dublin yesterday speaking passionately about the #EuropeanGreenDeal. We can, will and should be part of that, not by sticking to the status quo but by doing things in a better green way.  https://t.co/VLnlFOa6m0

Inspired by Sarah Moss 'I’d rather be part of a country that’s mostly able to have a heated discussion about change than one locked in division and rage, and one able to think about its traditions &:move forward rather than longing for an imaginary past.' https://t.co/uZYl9c3cQH

We've badgers, otters, foxes, kingfishers, dippers, herons, salmon, trout and a myriad other creatures living along our city river. It's never been cleaner in three hundred years. Don't give up on nature. As @whittledaway argues, we can turn paradise lost into paradise regained. https://t.co/j1lENNjXjF
@LeftLost_Pltcs @greenparty_ie yes we will.

Katie Ryan from @MuckrossCollege entered #BTYSTE2020 investigating how greater marine acidity due to climate change, might effect microscopic Tardigrade creatures.  The same students who were raising the climate alarm are now coming up with solutions.  #CreateTodayShapeTomorrow https://t.co/0PvGAEenUZ

.@RoisinGarvey launches her general election campaign in the Old Ground Hotel Ennis. The statue of Daniel O' Connell outside reminds us of the democratic values we seek to promote. Great sense of a green wave of thinking still on the rise across the country. #clare #greenwave https://t.co/4u7diV3yxA
Looking forward to the launch of @RoisinGarvey campaign in Ennis this afternoon. https://t.co/LxcoecPcZ7

'In Australia today, a political establishment, grown sclerotic and demented on its own fantasies, is facing a monstrous reality which it has neither the ability nor the will to confront.' #AustraliaOnFire https://t.co/ournuKt83S

We have no idea which revolution is about to happen – the positive transformation or the catastrophic consequence of a failure our species to adapt in order to survive. #ClimateEmergency #Ireland https://t.co/ujgnxx7bgy
So sorry to hear this news. Marian was a great broadcaster and an important voice in Irish society for so many years. Ar Dheis Dé go raibh a hanam. https://t.co/4R4PdFWZ97
Athbhliain faoi mhaise oraibh go léir. Happy New Year everyone. #errigal #donegal https://t.co/uDVjN1hyf7
@NiallLeahy myself, in a tradition I inherited from my dad.
Wishing everyone a peaceful and Happy Christmas. #NollaigShona https://t.co/rWq1J15qOV

I met a friend on Grafton Street today, who saw the reality of homelessness casting a pall over Christmas celebrations. Good to remember then that #sleepout19 is still taking place. Reminding us of what's important. @belvosleepout @FocusIreland @NiamhHoran https://t.co/fTr2dVXZbc https://t.co/638lxp83oD

We were heartbroken by news of the death of Cormac. He was the most remarkable and inspiring young man. His passing is such a loss to Irish politics and our thoughts and prayers are with his family and his many friends in @labour, @ScoutingIreland & @ucddublin. https://t.co/wcuIoBp4B0

The lack of progress in #COP25 is a failure of political leadership. We need to show the way forward by advancing our own new Green deal, as part of a European Union initiative. It's time for us to be leaders not laggards in tackling the climate crisis.  https://t.co/EYoykPBhxd
Twelve days to #Christmas. Painting #cards for friends from memories. #inishbofin #twelvebens #connemara  1/12. https://t.co/DgKIi4UbRi https://t.co/hIz0nmxw23

The international climate negotiations could leave you depressed, as progress is so slow. But today is a day when Europe launches a new green deal at the centre of our new economic strategy. I think Irish people are ready to make the necessary leap and that gives me hope. #COP25 https://t.co/A8hnHKJzIf

Astronaut Luca Parmitano speaks to #COP25 from the International space station about the 'overview effect'. Those who see our earth from afar seem to find a new found love for the planet. #motherearth https://t.co/ztMtGagHRc

Mary Robinson explaining a moment of extraordinary empathy she felt with mother nature, during a visit to Greenland where she heard the dramatic sound from glaciers breaking apart. #COP25 #MotherNature https://t.co/YlQLot5rhZ

The @EU_Commission has launched a #EuropeanGreenDeal which is described as our historic 'moonshot' moment. I believe the Irish people are ready & willing to play our part and will gain from the transition. Watch live now the debate in  @EUparliament here: https://t.co/gmwA1koVfr https://t.co/zLgiGuRjbl

.@GretaThunberg sets out the science behind the climate emergency, calls out the lack of action from Governments & Corporations and then concludes with a message of hope, that we the people are ready for change. #COP25 #ClimateEmergency #climatestrike #FridaysForFurture https://t.co/4xOPrG7hyt

At #COP25 in Madrid. Friends telling me the key objective is to clear diplomatic obstacles, so countries can concentrate on raising ambition in COP26 next year. Problem is we always seem to be waiting just another year, while still sailing on into ever more dangerous waters. https://t.co/pccIhH009c
@edelh don't we know where she got it from.

Many thanks to Robert Fitzgerald for organising the event and finishing it off with this poem. 'No matter what the weather, we are better off when we come together.' #togetherness #earthmanbob https://t.co/841AY6aiOi

Great conversation about how we promote cycling in our city this morning. We've being saying for 30 years that Dublin could become a great cycling city. In the next ten years I think we could finally make it happen. #ibikeivote #wantgreenvotegreen #Dublin https://t.co/vtPL6K0h64
Tomorrow morning. https://t.co/YrLHp4r8mg
I went down to the bowels of Leinster House to the new @RTE studio to record this podcast today. https://t.co/uODclGU4yO
Looking forward to going to this tonight. https://t.co/RkS9asrD3Q

Poor air quality is a major health hazard in communities across the country. Very disappointing that @RichardbrutonTD is yielding to legal threats and not proceeding with a wider smokey coal ban. He could do it in conjunction with a phased restriction of wet wood & peat products. https://t.co/KMORcIDRer
. @BrianLeddin would make a great TD for #Limerick. I think he has a real chance of winning a seat at the upcoming general election. https://t.co/4Nf0pPGPnZ
We were honoured to have @KarinDubsky on our team. She ran a great first time campaign, from a standing start only a few weeks ago. https://t.co/6kIIDO1UOY
Joe is going to be a brilliant representative for the people of Fingal. A great day for @greenparty_ie https://t.co/gw3IP1bJ2K
https://t.co/3fBR3fzOVs

Very proud of how @TheKavOfficial did in the Dublin Mid West by-election, big increase in our vote and building a base for the future. Many thanks for everyone who voted green yesterday. https://t.co/VI0A6tPclB
